alert.note: Alert for Cass (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 8:03PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cass County through 830 PM CDT... At 803 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Freeman, or 9 miles southwest of Harrisonville, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Freeman and Lake Annette. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
